alert.note: Alert for Uintah (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 02 at 1:44PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Utah, including the following county, Uintah. * WHEN...Until 445 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 144 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Cottonwood Wash, Hill Creek, Meadow Creek, Main Canyon and Willow Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Southwestern Uintah County
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
